title.rendered: Badrinath Weather – Badrinath Climate & Temperature Updates

content.rendered:
Perched on a massive elevation of 3,300 metres above sea level and amongst the mighty greenery and charming beauty of the imposing Himalayas, Badrinath dham is a true testament of Hindu religion and the deep spirituality which it successfully signifies. The region gets its name due to the presence of thick and lush green forests of jujube and badri trees which used to cover the area during the ancient ages. The dham was reestablished by Adi Shankaracharya during the 7th century as a ways of reigniting the feeling of Hinduism which according to him was slowly being extinguished amongst the Hindu population in India. A visit to this Chota char dham as well as all India char dham site will fill your heart with a feeling of not only deep spirituality but with also some stunning and scenic natural beauty which cannot be experienced anywhere else in the world.

Month Wise Weather Conditions

Due to its incredible location Badrinath dham experience a typical climate and weather conditions as that of all the other hilly terrain towns and villages. If you are Planning on Visiting Badrinath Dham then you should be sure about when you should go. Here is a month wise description of the weather condition that goes on throughout the year in Badrinath which will allow you to have a good time during your spiritual journey:

January – The average temperature during this time remains freezing and easily goes below zero till -12 degree Celsius. The overall environment remains freezing cold and pilgrim visited is strictly prohibited.

February – The overall temperature here still remains extremely cold and freezing with the temperature going as low as -8 degree Celsius and the region also experiences heavy snowfall.

March – The temperature dramatically rises during this time with the average temperature during this time touching till 5 degree Celsius. However, this month relatively has no effect on the overall environment of Badrinath dham but the snow here atleast gradually starts to melt away.

April – The temperature witnesses and average high of 7 degree Celsius but the region still remains covered in heavy snowfall and the entire environment here gets freezing cold by sundown. The temple kapat opens for darshan sometimes by the end of this month.

May – This month marks the onset of the summer season where the temperature rises to as high as 10 degree Celsius and is considered to be the best time to travel and offer their darshan to Lord Badri. The overall weather remains extremely pleasant, comfortable and warm for pilgrims.

June – This is also another one of the best month to visit Badrinath dham since the temperature during this time rises till as high as 15 degree Celsius but by sun down the temperature falls also dramatically.

July – The beginning of the month is considered to be a favorable time to visit Badri Vishal while as the month goes on the temperature and the weather conditions deteriorate and it changes into extremely cold and rainy. The temperature during this time stays between 16 to 10 degree Celsius.

August – The temperature and weather conditions during this month remains extremely unpredictable and harsh while all the roads are shut down for travel and helicopter services are also suspended. Badrinath remains drenched in cold and rainy climatic conditions.

September – The rainy season gradually dies out by the end of September and pilgrim activities become active. The temperature here remains 14 to 5 degree Celsius. Be prepared to face some random showers.

October – The temperature in Badrinath during this month continues to drop and go to as low as 12 degree Celsius. There may also be some rainfall that takes place here. This is also considered to be a good time to visit Badrinath dham.

November – The weather changes to becoming extremely cold along with some simultaneous snowfall. The temperature during this time goes to subzero levels of -2 degree Celsius. The kapat for Badrinath dham also closes for darshan to the pilgrims during this time and the idol of the presiding deity is shifted to his winter home in Joshimath.

December – The temple kapat is completely shut down for pilgrims as well as visitors where the temperature goes to as low as -10 degree Celsius. Temple gets completely buried inside a thick layer of snow.

Best Time to Visit

The summer months of April to June are considered to be the best and the peak season for travelling to Badrinath for darshan. These months are considered to be extremely pleasant and comfortable for making the journey. The pilgrims will also be able to experience the beauty of the Himalayas.
